author: HeadTopics.com
title: Tellado, Paquita la del Barrio y esta España que no termina de romperse
text:
Sánchez desespera al PP con su esfuerzo por recuperar la normalidad de la legislatura mientras Vox exhibe su agenda radical
Hace tres años, por estas fechas, se estaba celebrando en el Congreso el último Debate del Estado de la Nación, el único con Pedro Sánchez como presidente del Gobierno, el primero después de siete años de bucle infernal de repeticiones electorales e investiduras fallidas.
Vox y su agenda de provocación siguen siendo un componente fundamental en el pegamento de socios tan dispares como los de Sánchez mientras el PP sostiene que los de Abascal tienen “más sentido de Estado que el PSOE” y Alberto Núñez Feijóo evita ponerles veto como aliados. Se compromete a gobernar en solitario, pero nadie va a las elecciones diciendo lo contrario.
España Últimas Noticias, España Titulares
Similar News:También puedes leer noticias similares a ésta que hemos recopilado de otras fuentes de noticias.

El PP espera ya a Tellado como relevo de Gamarra en Génova: 'Es lo lógico'Periodista sevillano. Tras licenciarse, cursó el máster de EL MUNDO, diario al que se incorporó en 2006. Desde finales de 2007 hasta 2018 trabajó en Expansión, antes de recalar de nuevo en EL MUNDO, donde escribe de política y se encarga sobre todo de seguir al PP y mantiene la columna informativa Más madera.

author: WHAM Staff
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Our overnight storm did not disappoint! A mix of rain and snow made it into the Las Vegas valley!{/p}{p}Lee Canyon is reporting around 8\" of new snow along with3\" of snow in Kyle Canyon, 4\" of snow in Rainbow Canyon and up to 1\" of snow in Anthem. Flakes were also flying in Summerlin with snow sticking in some neighborhoods in Henderson on the edges of town. Rainfall amounts in the valley were very light, measuring around a trace of showers up to .12\".{/p}{p}TODAY: Now that the showers have cleared out, we'll see gusty winds for the rest of the day. A WIND ADVISORY is in effect through 10am for sustained northwest winds 20-30 mph with wind gusts around 45 mph. As winds pick up, areas of blowing dust may be possible especially around construction sites. Breezes will very slowly back down throughout the rest of the day with high temperatures struggling to make it to 50 degrees in Las Vegas. The normal high temperature this time of the year is 58 degrees for some perspective.{/p}{p}Air and pollen levels are low.{/p}{p}TONIGHT: Skies will be mostly clear this evening with cold around the freezing mark, 32 degrees. Temperatures may be a bit lower on the edges of town.{/p}{p}YOUR 7 DAY: Much calmer on Friday with mostly sunny skies and valley highs in the low to mid 50s. Temperatures will keep climbing into the weekend as high pressure builds in with highs in the upper 50s by Sunday. A storm system will pass to our north but most of the impacts will be across Northern Nevada Saturday night into Sunday with the storm moving east. The latest storm tracks don't show much impact to Southern Nevada except additional clouds.{/p}{p}On Martin Luther King Jr. Day expect mostly sunny skies with light northeast winds up to 10 mph. 57 degrees by the afternoon.{/p}{p}Temperatures will be on the rise again through the work week with valley highs reaching the low 60s by Wednesday. There's some uncertainty over the weather pattern next week with an outside chance of showers possible late Wednesday... but the odds are around 10%....{/p}{p}In the extended forecast, valley high temperatures appear to stay in the low to mid 60s NEXT Thursday through Saturday.{/p}{p}Check back for Koast{/p}{p}A mayor in New York is calling for an investigation after {a href=\"https://13wham.com/news/local/mayor-malik-evans-calls-for-investigation-after-patient-gets-kicked-out-of-ambulance-in-rochester-before-dying-seneca-avenue-amr\" //13wham.com/news/local/mayor-malik-evans-calls-for-investigation-after-patient-gets-kicked-out-of-ambulance-in-rochester-before-dying-seneca-avenue-amr\"}a man suffering a medical crisis was asked to leave an ambulance and later died{/a}.{/p}{p}Rochester Mayor Malik Evans held a news conference Thursday to discuss the incident, which happened Nov. 30. The city later released video of the incident.{/p}{p}The video appears to shows a man, who was having trouble breathing, being asked to leave one ambulance and wait on the street for another to arrive and take him to the hospital. The man falls to the sidewalk and waits more than two minutes before medical personnel helped him.{/p}{p}The man died shortly before Christmas, according to Evans, who said he didn't find out about the incident until Tuesday and was \"flabbergasted\" by it. He called on ambulance provider American Medical Response to conduct an internal investigation.{/p}{blockQuote: }Even though this was a medical scene, there are always lessons to be learned -- particularly as it relates to what type of ambulance services our medical services our community are experiencing,\" Evans said. \"City residents are people, and they deserve to be treated humanely and with the same attention as anyone else.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}Police had been called to the ambulance for a reported assault against an EMT and were present when the man fell. Police Chief David Smith has also called for an internal investigation.{/p}{blockQuote: }I want to know why they chose to call the police,\" Evans said. \"I want to know why personnel required someone in distress to be removed from an ambulance instead of being taken directly to the hospital.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}In a statement, the city added AMR \"has committed to working to determine the reasons this incident occurred, address the gaps in the care that was provided to this patient, and fix whatever led to this unacceptable situation.\"{/p}{p}\"We must get to the bottom of this,\" Evans said. \"We must understand how and why this occurred and we must identify processes and safeguards to insure that this does not ever happen again.\"{/p}{p}Our overnight storm did not disappoint! A mix of rain and snow made it into the Las Vegas valley!{/p}{p}Lee Canyon is reporting around 8\" of new snow along with3\" of snow in Kyle Canyon, 4\" of snow in Rainbow Canyon and up to 1\" of snow in Anthem. Flakes were also flying in Summerlin with snow sticking in some neighborhoods in Henderson on the edges of town. Rainfall amounts in the valley were very light, measuring around a trace of showers up to .12\".{/p}{p}TODAY: Now that the showers have cleared out, we'll see gusty winds for the rest of the day. A WIND ADVISORY is in effect through 10am for sustained northwest winds 20-30 mph with wind gusts around 45 mph. As winds pick up, areas of blowing dust may be possible especially around construction sites. Breezes will very slowly back down throughout the rest of the day with high temperatures struggling to make it to 50 degrees in Las Vegas. The normal high temperature this time of the year is 58 degrees for some perspective.{/p}{p}Air and pollen levels are low.{/p}{p}TONIGHT: Skies will be mostly clear this evening with cold around the freezing mark, 32 degrees. Temperatures may be a bit lower on the edges of town.{/p}{p}YOUR 7 DAY: Much calmer on Friday with mostly sunny skies and valley highs in the low to mid 50s. Temperatures will keep climbing into the weekend as high pressure builds in with highs in the upper 50s by Sunday. A storm system will pass to our north but most of the impacts will be across Northern Nevada Saturday night into Sunday with the storm moving east. The latest storm tracks don't show much impact to Southern Nevada except additional clouds.{/p}{p}On Martin Luther King Jr. Day expect mostly sunny skies with light northeast winds up to 10 mph. 57 degrees by the afternoon.{/p}{p}Temperatures will be on the rise again through the work week with valley highs reaching the low 60s by Wednesday. There's some uncertainty over the weather pattern next week with an outside chance of showers possible late Wednesday... but the odds are around 10%....{/p}{p}In the extended forecast, valley high temperatures appear to stay in the low to mid 60s NEXT Thursday through Saturday.{/p}{p}Check back for Koast{/p}{p}A mayor in New York is calling for an investigation after {a href=\"https://13wham.com/news/local/mayor-malik-evans-calls-for-investigation-after-patient-gets-kicked-out-of-ambulance-in-rochester-before-dying-seneca-avenue-amr\" //13wham.com/news/local/mayor-malik-evans-calls-for-investigation-after-patient-gets-kicked-out-of-ambulance-in-rochester-before-dying-seneca-avenue-amr\"}a man suffering a medical crisis was asked to leave an ambulance and later died{/a}.{/p}{p}Rochester Mayor Malik Evans held a news conference Thursday to discuss the incident, which happened Nov. 30. The city later released video of the incident.{/p}{p}The video appears to shows a man, who was having trouble breathing, being asked to leave one ambulance and wait on the street for another to arrive and take him to the hospital. The man falls to the sidewalk and waits more than two minutes before medical personnel helped him.{/p}{p}The man died shortly before Christmas, according to Evans, who said he didn't find out about the incident until Tuesday and was \"flabbergasted\" by it. He called on ambulance provider American Medical Response to conduct an internal investigation.{/p}{blockQuote: }Even though this was a medical scene, there are always lessons to be learned -- particularly as it relates to what type of ambulance services our medical services our community are experiencing,\" Evans said. \"City residents are people, and they deserve to be treated humanely and with the same attention as anyone else.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}Police had been called to the ambulance for a reported assault against an EMT and were present when the man fell. Police Chief David Smith has also called for an internal investigation.{/p}{blockQuote: }I want to know why they chose to call the police,\" Evans said. \"I want to know why personnel required someone in distress to be removed from an ambulance instead of being taken directly to the hospital.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}In a statement, the city added AMR \"has committed to working to determine the reasons this incident occurred, address the gaps in the care that was provided to this patient, and fix whatever led to this unacceptable situation.\"{/p}{p}\"We must get to the bottom of this,\" Evans said. \"We must understand how and why this occurred and we must identify processes and safeguards to insure that this does not ever happen again.\"{/p}

author: Hadeel Hashem
title: UN Chief Calls for Immediate Ceasefire in Gaza, Reaffirms Palestinian Right to Statehood
text:
Crow Agency Man Sentenced for Meth Trafficking in Multi-State Conspiracy
UN Chief Calls for Immediate Ceasefire in Gaza, Reaffirms Palestinian Right to Statehood
In a fervent appeal to the international community, United Nations Secretary-General, Antonio Guterres, has amplified his call for an immediate ceasefire in the strife-torn Gaza Strip. The call comes amid escalating conflict, intensifying human suffering, and the critical shortage of basic life necessities in the region.
Guterres Speaks at the NAM Summit
Addressing the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) summit in Uganda, Guterres underscored the dire humanitarian situation in Gaza, where the inhabitants grapple daily with a lack of food, clean water, electricity, and essential medical supplies in hospitals. The ongoing strife and the worsening living conditions, he warned, necessitate immediate action, else they risk causing further loss of life.
The Right to Statehood
During his remarks, Guterres stressed the importance of acknowledging the right of the Palestinian people to establish their own state. He depicted any denial of this fundamental right as unacceptable, viewing it as a significant obstacle to securing lasting peace between Israelis and Palestinians.
The Gaza Conflict
The conflict, which has been steadily escalating, surged in intensity following a Hamas attack on southern Israel on October 7, leading to significant casualties. The subsequent Israeli offensive has resulted in the death of at least 24,927 Palestinians, with women and children forming a majority of the casualties, as reported by the Hamas health ministry in Gaza.
The World Health Organization has vehemently condemned the inhumane living conditions in Gaza, where approximately 2.4 million people are grappling with the challenge of accessing their basic needs in the midst of conflict.
As the conflict continues to claim lives and shatter existences, the international community waits, hoping for a resolution that can bring an end to the bloodshed and pave the way for a peaceful future.
Comments

Sign up for our daily newsletter covering global breaking news around the world.

author: TNN
title: Feels Like Winter, Finally: Fog Hits Rail Traffic, Pulls Down Max Temp | Ludhiana News - Times of India
text: Ludhiana: With the temperature dropping by nearly 6°C, dense fog enveloped Ludhiana on Thursday, bringing down visibility in the morning to 100 metres and impacting rail traffic too.The worse is yet to come, as the meteorological department has issued a red warning for Ludhiana for Friday and Saturday, predicting dense to very dense fog. A red warning is issued for the authorities concerned to take action in view of high predictability of adverse weather conditions. More trains are expected to get delayed in future too. Ludhiana railway station superintendent Amrik Singh said 10-12 trains were delayed because of poor visibility during the day, with the Jammu Rajdhani, which plies from New Delhi to Jammu Tawi, getting delayed by more than five hours.While visibility was poor for most of the morning, it improved to 350 metres by 11.30am. There was moderate fog for the remaining part of the day and sunlight could barely make it past the grey skies. Day temperature dropped to 12.8°C in the city, 5.9°C below normal and fall of 5.8°C from Wednesday.The minimum temperature, also called night temperature, was recorded at 10.3°C, which is 5°C above normal. As per the meteorological department, day temperature in the city might rise to 21°C by Sunday, whereas night temperature might fall to 9°C on Friday. It could further fall to 6°C by next week. Residents too had a difficult time because of poor visibility in the morning hours. Deepak Kumar, a resident, said he was driving on the Southern bypass that runs parallel to Sidhwan canal, but had to stay slow due to fog. Major trains which were delayed because of bad weather included Malwa Express, Amritsar Shatabdi and Shan-e-Punjab. We also published the following articles recentlyDense fog envelopes parts of North India, reduces visibilityThe winter chill continues to grip North India with dense fog in cities like Kanpur, Aligarh, Prayagraj, and Meerut in Uttar Pradesh, and Gwalior in Madhya Pradesh. Locals gathered around bonfires for warmth on the streets. The India Meteorological Department recorded visibility of 00m in Agra, Prayagraj, and Gwalior. In Delhi, the temperature dropped to 9.4 degrees Celsius with visibility as low as 125 meters. The air quality in Delhi remained 'very poor' with an AQI of around 400, leading to a ban on non-essential construction work in the Delhi-NCR region.106267801Dense fog engulfs Delhi-NCR; flights, trains delayedDelhi experiences dense fog with reduced visibility, causing delays for flights. Temperature drops to 7 degrees Celsius. Air Quality Index (AQI) remains in the \"very poor\" category at 374. Isolated pockets of Delhi and surrounding areas expected to have very dense fog. Air pollution continues to be a major concern.106281393IMD issues red warning for very dense fog todayThe weather department has issued a red warning for very dense fog in Delhi-NCR on Friday, urging people not to venture out in their vehicles between 4 am and 10 am. The warning aims to prevent car pile-ups and accidents caused by low visibility. The improvement in fog conditions on Thursday was due to overnight winds, but the wind speed is expected to drop on Friday, leading to very dense fog. The IMD has also issued an orange alert for dense to moderate fog on Saturday. The air quality in Delhi remains very poor, and the situation is not favorable for effective dispersion of pollutants.106362105

author: editor@martinoticias.com (Yolanda Huerga)
title: Madre de presa política acusa a sus carceleros de mentir para que pusiera fin a protesta
text:
Las autoridades de la prisión Cuba Panamá para enfermos de VIH, mintieron a la presa política Yilian Oramas García cuando afirmaron que cancelarían su transferencia a un régimen de mayor severidad para que abandonara la huelga de hambre.
Oramas García se declaró en ayuno total en protesta por la que consideraba una medida arbitraria, denunció en declaraciones a Martí Noticias Josefa Oramas, la madre de la prisionera política.
“No le han quitado la revocación, ni le están dando pases. A ella la pasaron para la parte cerrada desde el primer momento que llegó a la prisión. Su retraso fue de tres o cuatro horas, porque ese día no había transporte. La Seguridad del Estado me dijo a mí que la revocación, lo que faltaba era quitarla de la máquina, que no entiendo: si no han sancionado a un recluso, por qué está en la máquina [la computadora].
Oramas García inició su protesta el 13 de agosto, cuando los mandos del penal ubicado en la provincia Mayabeque le informaron que había perdido sus beneficios por atrasarse en el regreso de un pase a su vivienda situada en la ciudad de Santa Clara, a más de 250 kilómetros de la prisión donde está recluida.
Luego de más de diez días en ayuno voluntario, suspendió su protesta con la promesa de los mandos penitenciarios y de la Seguridad del Estado de que cambiarían la medida punitiva a la suspensión de dos visitas a su hogar.
“Mintieron para que ella levantara la huelga. El Jefe de la Unidad, Camilo Zúñiga, dice que él no puede darle pases hasta que no le quiten de la máquina la sanción, que la Seguridad del Estado tiene que llevar un documento”, lamentó la madre.
Yilian Oramas García, de 43 años, cumple una sentencia de seis años de privación de libertad por su participación en una protesta el 15 de agosto de 2021 en la capital villaclareña, en la que ella, su esposo y otras personas exigieron que el gobierno tomara medidas para brindar adecuada asistencia hospitalaria a los enfermos de Covid-19, y que se implementaran mejoras en los servicios mortuorios.

author: newsdirectory3
title: South African Influencer Beandri Booysen Dies at 19 From Progeria
text:
Young Influencer Beandri Booysen, ⁤Advocate for Progeria awareness, Passes Away at 19 Beandri Booysen , a‍ South African influencer known for her vibrant‍ personality and advocacy for progeria awareness, has died at the age of 19. Her mother⁢ announced the heartbreaking news on the family’s Facebook page, ⁤”Beandri, our inspiration.”
Booysen, who was⁤ born on November 20, 2005, ​was the last known survivor of progeria in ​South Africa. Progeria is a rare genetic disorder that causes‍ accelerated aging.Despite the challenges ​she faced, Booysen radiated hope and happiness, becoming a symbol of resilience and inspiration for⁣ thousands around the world.
“Beandri was one of ​the‌ moast loved and inspiring women in South Africa,” ⁤the Facebook ‍post read. “She was⁢ known for her vibrant personality and contagious laughter. Despite the⁤ challenges she​ faced, Beandri radiated hope ‌and happiness. She became a ​symbol of awareness for progeria and ⁢other special needs, and used ⁣her unique spirit to inspire thousands of people worldwide.”
The family has requested privacy during this ‍arduous time ⁢as they grieve the ⁤loss of their beloved Beandri. Details regarding memorial⁤ services will be ⁢shared‍ at a ‍later date.
Hopeful spirit Lost: Beandri‌ Booysen, South⁣ African⁢ Progeria ⁤Advocate, ​Passes Away at 19 Cape Town, South Africa – The world mourns‌ the ‌loss of Beandri Booysen, ⁢a young influencer and tireless advocate‍ for progeria awareness, who passed away at the age of 19.
Beandri, the last known survivor of progeria in South Africa, was⁢ born on November ⁤20, 2005. Despite the challenges posed by this⁢ rare genetic disorder,which causes accelerated aging,Beandri became ​a beacon of hope and inspiration for thousands worldwide.
Her mother announced the ⁤heartbreaking news on the family’s Facebook⁣ page, “Beandri, our inspiration.” ‌
“Beandri was one of the most loved and inspiring women in ‍South ⁢Africa. She was known for her⁤ vibrant⁤ personality and contagious laughter. despite the ⁣challenges she faced, Beandri radiated hope and ⁢happiness.She became a symbol of awareness for progeria and⁢ other special needs, and used her unique⁣ spirit to inspire thousands of people worldwide.”
The family has requested privacy at this time as they grieve. Details regarding⁣ memorial services will be shared at ⁤a⁣ later date.
